top_categories.workout_context: At mile 60 of 120, glycogen is gone. This workout teaches your body to produce watts on fumes.
Pony Express 120's Kansas rolling farmland/prairie gravel rewards steady threshold power. Surging and recovering costs more watts than just holding.
Pony Express 120's Kansas farmland/prairie, Rolling gravel forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 120 miles.
Race-pace efforts that mimic Pony Express 120's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before September.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of Pony Express 120. Train it until it feels boring.
At Pony Express 120, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
Every hard session works better with a bigger aerobic base. At 120 miles, base fitness is the difference between racing and surviving.
120 miles rewards fat oxidation. This volume work shifts your fuel mix so you're still burning fat at hour 5, not bonking at hour 3.
When someone attacks on Kansas rolling farmland/prairie gravel, you have 10 seconds to respond or you're off the back. This builds that response.
Endurance with intensity spikes baked in. Exactly what 4,000ft of climbing on Kansas rolling farmland/prairie gravel does to your power file on race day.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At Pony Express 120, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
Two threshold sessions per week without the recovery cost of VO2max work. For 120 miles, sustainable FTP gains matter more than peak power.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 60–80g carbs/hour for Pony Express 120’s 120 miles. Start fueling within the first 30 minutes — early fueling prevents late-race collapse. Bonking at mile 60 is a nutrition failure, not a fitness failure.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Pony Express 120 requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on kansas rolling farmland/prairie gravel to build confidence. Expect: kansas farmland/prairie, rolling gravel, 120-mile distance.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Durability, TT Threshold, and Gravel Specific to prepare you for 120 miles of kansas rolling farmland/prairie gravel in Marysville, Kansas.
